element.name: DESCRIPTION
element.text:
This algorithm takes a vector layer and a field from its attributes table and adds a new numerical field to it. This new field will match the selected field, so if a two features have the same value for that field, they will also have identical values in the new field.
This is useful when rasterizing a vector layer. Since only numerical values can be used in raster layers, rasterizing a non-numerical field is not possible. Creating an equivalent numerical field solves this problem.

element.name: LAYER
element.text: The input layer. The new field will be added to the attributes table of this layer.

element.name: NEW_FIELD_NAME
element.text: The name for the field to create with the equivalent numerical class.

element.name: CLASS_FIELD
element.text: The field that contains the non-numerical class values.

element.name: RESULT
element.text: The resulting layer with a new numerical class field added to its attributes table.
